description: A local told us about this place. She said "you won't get a better slice in the city," she may have been right. The pizza was okay and the service was very good but I didn't think it was anything to write home about. If you're in the area stop by and hang out it's not bad.
author: Luis H.

description: This is my favorite place. I pop in to chat with the best owners of the Best pizza in San Francisco.  I call in my order on the way home and the pizza is awesome and try the chocolate mousse cake addictive lol.
author: Rey B.

description: Pepperoni and a slice of cheesecake. That is all you need. Open late and they are very nice.
author: Karla C.

description: Ordered a pizza & Pretty sure, they just used a old slice pie & tossed a ton of cheese on it. Worse than frozen pizza
author: Toby D.

description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this local pizza joint last night and were so impressed by its deliciousness! We are always looking out for legit New York style pizza and this place hits the spot! Great ingredients, affordable prices, and great customer service. We had the pleasure of chatting with the owner who has had his resturant for over 35 years! We will be back!
author: Anoush Y.

description:
Bus Stop Pizza has been around for 31 years now and it is truly a slice of the San Francisco that was. The original owners are still there and cranking out the BEST New York style pizza west of New York. Their sauce is authentic and their crispy thin crust is perfectly done. It's not all fancy and 'foody' or whatever. It's DAMN . GOOD. PIZZA.
To the Millennials and hipster kids: so the place isn't paneled with reclaimed beach wood or whatever..you want a good slice of pizza? THIS is where you go.
When I lived at Fell and Divisadero they pretty much were at my house with dinner 2-3 times a week (I was a bike messenger, so I could inhale calories like nobody's business). They got to know me and even would stop and pick me up a deck of smokes if I asked them. They were family and treated me as such. 
SF has changed so much, some of it good, some of it not, but Bus Stop harkens back to before the middle class couldn't live in The City. Good people, good pizza.
Delivery available as well as a couple o' stools to sit and chat with the wonderful owners as you eat.
Stop by. You won't regret it.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Thank God for this place I love getting slices of pizza here.
author: Nicholas K.

description: I come here often because I work right next to it. Great service. The owners are awesome and the pizza is great for the price and consistent
author: April D.

description: Favorite pizza in SF. $4 slice with a topping. Pure fresh delicious, no nonsense pizza .  Owner is incredibly friendly and will remember your order by your second visit! Prefect way to start or end your night in Haight Ashbury
author: Justin H.

description:
TLDR: the slices are huge, thick, crispy, and cheesy. I always get pepperoni and sausage. They reheat well.

I live right by this place so maybe I'm biased. They've been there for me after a few too many beers when the only thing anyone needs more than a horizontal surface to lay on...is pizza. And this pizza is legit. I moved to SF from NYC and am really glad I have this gem on my block. Thin crust it is not.
author: Cindy T.

description: Quality significantly outdone by its prices. $1.00 NY style Pissarro for $3.25 and up.
author: McLain K.

description: Slightly concerned about the food cleanliness here.. I ordered my pizza slice and the toppings were prepared without any gloves on, and he proceeded to touching money (bills and coins). Let's see if I get sick...
author: Amanda Y.

description:
This place has become my go-to for pizza.  The 'Bus Stop Special" is always soo good.  love to get a slice, take it home and open a bottle of  wine.  Makes for a perfect night with Netflix.   The owner is always so nice, and really knows how to make that crust CRISPY.   Easy, fast and cheap!
Even if you have to take it home and eat it much later, it reheats perfectly in the oven.
author: Amy N.

description: Pizza is very good the prices are very cheap I would recommend buying one slice because they are huge the place looks clean but small very kind and friendly
author: Brianna C.

description: The place is very nice and clean. Great service. Pizza is mediocre and the price is good for what the food really is. The slice is very big. I recommend this place.
author: Ivan C.

description: My favorite place to order pizza when I was a kid.  I don't care how much it's changed for better or worse, it's an SF legend!!
author: RJ J.

description: I really like this spot for a slice. You pick the toppings and they had them fresh on top and stick it in the oven. It really hits the spot. Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I'll stop in.
author: Zara S.

description: So I remember using bus stop pizza as a kids for a few years. I called up and ordered a pizza gave my address and my cross street Buchanan St & Golden Gate Ave the woman over the phone says " I will call you to come outside to the car" So I said "what do you mean come to the car it's called delivery deliver it to my door" so she says "No because it's not the best area" REALLY WOW well I will NOT patronize your business and I will be writing a review about THIS!! How dare you my money is just as good as anybody else's and if you choose NOT to deliver in Western Addition District  well that's your lost. I'm ordering from EXTREME PIZZA ON FILLMORE STREET in my neighborhood where I am born and raised!!!! or Deja Vu pizza on 16th Street near Guerrero Street. F*ck Bus Stop there are better pizza joints to spend your money.
author: SHRONDA J.

description: This restaurant is great! I love the pizza and the owners are incredibly friendly. The pizza is really well priced and also delicious! I'll be going back any chance I get!
author: Gina D.

description: Bus Stop Pizza is the perfect complement to your lazy weekend. I was working on my laptop in my bed when I realized it was 7:39 PM, and I was really hungry. I thought very seriously about ordering soup at a Chinese restaurant a 10 minute walk away but 1) remembered my roommate saying about an hour earlier that it was drizzling and 2) realized I had no desire of waiting 40+ minutes to eat (20 minutes round trip and 20 minutes to prepare my order). I therefore called up Bus Stop Pizza to put in my order, was told it would take 10 minutes, and promptly rolled in in my college t-shirt, grey sweatpants, Hunter boots, and a black trench coat. Within 6 minutes, I was back in my kitchen stuffing pesto and sausage pizza slices (two separate slices, though I'm sure they'd be happy to make you one slice with both) in my mouth. It was great. While Bus Stop Pizza may have a reputation for being great drunk food, I've only had it while sober, and I still think it's excellent. It's not gourmet pizza, but it's just so freakin' cheesy and delicious, and the slices are gigantic. My personal favorites are the pesto and the Bus Stop specialty slice.
author: Kelly R.

description: Had pizza twice from this place while visiting SF. We like it. The first night we caught them just before closing on Halloween after partying in the Castro. We were walking in the Haight and there it was food with no line to wait in. Bingo! Honestly, at that moment it was the best tasting food ever. LOL! So a few nights later, sober I might add, we were staying in for the night and decided to give them a second try for me it was their Hawaiian Pizza - fantastic. My partner had his old standby, Pepperoni. He said it was good and he would order from there again. The staff was very nice and some nice, short, conversation was had. All in all a repeat food stop for us when we return. Give them a try i think you will be surprised.
author: M T.

description: The best Pizza in Fillmoe! Real Frisco and genuine. Not a gentrification eatery.. will always support!! Love you guys..
author: Deo E.

description:
Why so few reviews?

My friends and I were craving for pizza after drinking. Damn u munchies!

Found bus stop pizza on yelp and was hoping they deliver around 12am and they do!

First time trying their pizza and now a fan

Got the Bus Stop combo pizza
sausages, pepperoni, onions, olives and tomatoes 

Über goodness

45 mins delivery time

Big chunks of sausages 
Pepperoni on the bottom beneath the white mozrella cheese so u get something in every bite

Great flavors

Not greesy at all

$26 for large, free delivery

Slept happy ;)

Slept
author: Carol Y.

description:
The preponderance of four star reviews for this place only makes me question San Franciscans understanding of pizza.  If it weren't for the boot and the shoe service I would really swear off pizza on the whole West Coast.  Alas it is an isolated problem.

This place has crappy pizza people.  I don't know if the ancient chinese secret was not made of cheese or what, but seriously.  What happened to this recipe?  There are tons of dollar pizzas back in Nueva York that could blow this place out of the water.

Too much cheese, sauce that tastes like straight from the can, barely warmed up.  Fail.
author: Sean S.

description:
I am not qualified to review the authenticity of Indian or Thai or many other types of cuisines. But NY-style pizza by the slice is one of the few dishes on which I have substantial experience and expertise.

If you are looking for a gourmet pizza, keep walking. If you want cilantro and basil and garlic and other fresh, organic ingredients keep walking. You are not the target customer nor is gourmet pizza the intended product to deliver. 

What do they serve then? Legitimately good cheese (or 1-2 simple topping) pizza by the slice. Soft yet crispy crust that re-heats exceptionally well. Apt mix of quality sauce and cheese. I've been blitzed, smashed, high, and stone sober eating here and every time it has delivered on its simple promise.

To top it off they have super friendly service at all hours of the day and always round prices to the nearest quarter so I'm not stuck with a pocket full of pennies.
author: Hugh W.

description:
First time experience.

I tried this place when my girlfriend and I stayed at Metro Hotel.
Being somewhat lazy, we didn't really want to go somewhere at the late hour it was.
So we decided to stop in to grab a few slices to take back to our hotel.

Grabbing a slice is as fast as grabbing a pizza at Little Caesars.
Slices are just about ready to go, all you have to do is tell them what toppings you want and then they pop it in the oven. Slices are generous.

The pizza falls somewhere in the average range.
It's fast and convenient when you don't want to fight the night crowd at Ragazza.
Or when you don't want to drive down the road to Castro to hit Marcello's.

Bus Stop is a very tiny place. Barely enough seating area. You're better off just to take it and leave.
The couple that run this place are friendly.
When you want to grab a soda, there is also a convenient store just adjacent from Bust Stop pizza. 

Careful... There are some nights that if they're slow, they might close early. And this coming from the owner's mouth.
author: John S.

description: All pizza is good. With that said, this pizza is not that good. Comparatively. For pizza. But this pizza is still good, compared to all possible foods.
author: m t.

description:
I stop in here whenever I get off the bus and realize I didn't plan for dinner. It's a small place and not big for more than a few people to eat-in at a time but I always get my slices to go. They custom make slices for you when you order, and it normally doesn't take more than a few minutes. 

The family that runs Bus stop is awesome. I made several confusing timed orders on Superbowl Sunday and they made sure they had everything right for me, I even had multiple people coming to pick stuff up.
author: Amy L.

description:
The Food.
Great veggie pizza. Freshly cut mushrooms and juicy tomatoes. The cheese was perfect not too much not too little. Great flavor ! 

The Service.
While we waited for our pizza he had Paul Bart the Mall Cop playing.  I was entertained and got to eat good food! :) 

Would I come back?
Oh yes I will be back again! I ate it so fast I was unable to instagram (find me @totallypopular) lol
author: Aleena N.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

I think I made the mistake of eating here while sober. It's $2.50+tax for a large mediocre slice. The crust is neither crispy nor chewy. The sauce is flat with neither saltiness nor acidity. Could barely notice the existense of the cheese. It wasn't offensive but it is not very good.

Greatly enjoyed watched 5 minutes of the candidates debate on TV with the owner and a couple of ornery locals.
author: Bob R.

description:
Pizza maker. Party enabler.

Woman who took my order was the best part. She remarked how the neighboring bars seemed extra full rather early this particular evening and was glad everyone was "getting the party started early." How supportive.

As for the eats my cheese slice was neither memorable nor disappointing. About the right size and quality for less than three bucks.

If you are one of those starting early consider Bus Stop Pizza an A-OK option to soak up the indulgence.
author: Jason B.

description: A really nice family runs this place.  No frills -- at all -- but good individual slices -- they come out nice a crisp.  I usually get mushroom, sausage and sun-dried tomato slices.
author: Dan G.

description:
PIzza by the slice!! Pies are generous and priced well. 

This is a family run place which I appreciate. I popped in there last week after not going in for 15 years because I moved out of the area. 

The food is still really great and priced well. Some of the best pizza in town from this New Yorkers experience. And get it with a salad for a full meal.
author: Fresh E.

description:
I've only lived in the city for about a year now, but I've always loved pizza, and I really miss my pizza place back home. I've been looking for a place in walking distance (i live close to the painted ladies), so far this place has been the best. The slices are big, fairly priced, and consistently good.

I almost always get my slices togo, but the one time I did eat there I noticed the sun can get really brutal in the afternoon. Mostly I just wish they opened earlier, I only know of one pizza place in my area open before noon. Other than that, thumbs up.
author: Jiro A.

description:
good enough to satiate a hunger if your waiting on the 24 or work/live/play in the area

for slices - the cheese pies are already prepped as the foundation, then if/when toppings are added, it's put into the oven for a couple minutes...which is fine as its certainly done at other joints & rather have this then warming lights on it all day

bonus was as we didn't have tv in our house, while listening to giants games on the radio if bases were loaded w/posey on deck or cain cruising..i'd dart over to catch a few ab's as the owner is friendly and always has the game on
author: Clark G.

description:
This place is like an extension of  my own kitchen. I eat here almost once a week, or more! This is as close to New York's Original Ray's Pizza (no mater which original ray's is your original ;-) as you're going to find anywhere in  the Bay Area. 

This place is oriented toward SLICES. They put toppings on over pre-cooked cheese slices and then sprinkle some cheese over and cook it some more to seal the deal. This can't be done when putting a fresh, full pizza together and it's what makes their slices better than their full pizzas.

Yes, no parking. But it's in front of a... (guess)... Bus Stop! So it's ideal for locals like me. If you are in the Haight, then stop by for a slice.
author: david b.

description: When I came here from class for the first time, I fell in love with this place. One of the best pizza joints I've been to in SF.
author: Darius A.

description: Wow it was pretty bad!  The cheese was weird, it was solid even after heating it up it wasn't stringy like cheese should be. They lack the amount of Pepperoni, none in the middle just some around the edges as you can see in my photo. And FYI I got sick the next day if you know what I mean. No bueno!
author: Karen T.

description:
What is it about reviewing Pizza that brings out the worst in Yelpers?  There is no Nobel Prize for knowing the best pizza like there is no award for following the most obscure indie band! 

Bus Stop is okay.  In my old neighborhood Cybelle's was what past for cheap pizza, and Bus Stop is way better than that.
author: Luke M.

description: Good location, good food, cool owner, family owned business. One of the best late night pizza spot in the city wohhoooo
author: Carlo M.

description: been here a couple times.  I usually get the veggie slice.  It is okay.  Tried the mushroom once - it was better.  They are skimpy on the cheese.  But the slice is a good size.  Crust could be cooked a slight bit more though.
author: Irfan R.

description: Pizza by the slice but they allow you to customize! That's right, you can add toppings to the slices. Not bad. The pizza does the job for late night excursions. If you consume while warm, it actually tastes half decent. Beware, unlike actually good pizza, this pizza is not great the morning after. The warmth and your own intoxication do wonders to hide the cardboard taste.
author: Vrushali P.

description: I love this place, and never had any problems. The guy who owns it is so chill and friendly when he's not too tired. My signature pizza is large/extra large with light cheese, fresh tomatoes, extra pineapple, sausages, mushrooms, and bell peppers. I like to pack on the toppings! I also love how they give coupons that don't expire, so you can easily knock off two dollars, or get free soda.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Gross! Too bad they only had one napkin left in the dispenser because I could've used a couple extra to blot off the tablespoon of excess grease on my mushroom pesto pizza. The concept of this pizza parlor is a bit unappetizing - topping(s) of your choice dumped on a sitting pizza and reheated. In my case, the mushrooms weren't cooked into the cheese as I'd like but were instead, uncooked and glued together by some clumps of melted mozzarella. There was a thin layer of tomato sauce used for cooking the basic slice, and the pesto slathered on top didn't taste too great + the majority of the 'pesto' was oil. I went in to pass the time waiting for the 24, it was near midnight and I was hungry, mistake!! This two topping slice (pesto sauce + mushrooms) cost me $3.83, I suggest you go to Marcello's in the Castro if you want an amazing slice of pizza for the same price!

Pro: Quick
author: Alison L.

description:
OK. Little Star, it ain't. And I say, so what?

This place is great for a straight-up slice of New York style pie on the cheap and you don't need a reservation. This is basic, no-nonsense pizza at it's best. You want Swedish eggplant or saffron? You're gonna have to look elsewhere. This is pizza; not quiche, folks.

Unfortunately, I don't live anywhere near Bus Stop anymore but when I'm even remotely close I will go out of my way for a piping hot slice with their mucho deliciouso pesto on top.

Grazi!
author: Jesse H.

description:
Ahh Bus Stop Pizza, you served me well when I was just right across the street from you.  Me and my girl decided to check this place out because well it was right across the street and we wanted a cheap meal so pizza usually never fails in that department.  As expected, it did not fail in the cheap department and was fairly tasty as well.

We came here a couple of times after that and would watch Basketball games while we ate.  Pizza and sports talk is an instant winner so this place made us feel super comfortable.
author: Mark G.

description: Have been ordering delivery for years. Always fast and friendly service. LOVE Jean! No answer when calling for delivery for past two weeks though.
author: Michael S.

description:
Damn, this used to be a good slice of NY right here--though not quite as good as Arinell's.  Others may have had a reheated slice, but I had two cheese slices, straight from the oven, and they were fantastic.  FYI, true NY pizza is judged by a slice of cheese pizza--there is no need for any toppings.  It's all about the crust, sauce, and cheese.

The crust was very thin, but not as thin as arinell's.  The sauce was good, but too sour for my taste in NY pizza--needed a little more sweetness I think.  The overall cheese-crust-sauce proportion was pretty much spot-on.  A nice even layer of cheese over the entire slice....ahhhh.... simply gorgeous.

(THANKS PREET, for the review to bring me here!  :))

Edit:  I dno't know what happened, but the last time I came here, I ordered a whole pie, and the crust was way thicker than the first time.  sigh  maybe you need to ask them to make it extra thin?
author: Fong L.

description:
Another day, another slice of mediocre pizza. My biggest pet peeve with this shithole is that they make the pizzas without toppings and then when you ask for them, they put them on and then re-heat them, so you end up with this super messy slice where your toppings fall off. I require topping integration - is this too much to ask? It leaves me yearning for my days of living across from Escape from NY, which as we all know, is good but you know, it's no Original Ray's. 

And for those of us who have had Original Ray's, in many of its various incarnations, you know shit is bad when you start daydreaming about a slice of pizza there.  Anyway, it's telling that the only people who eat here are those of us who live in the illustrious Panhandle South (tm Megan W) neighborhood.  Convenience always wins.
author: Maria D.

description:
I always want to recommend this place to people, but then I remember that it's not all that.  The reason I go through these mental calisthenics each time is that first impressions are, indeed, hard to break.

Flash back to 2003.  The Iraq War has just begun; Republicans seem ascendant, and San Francisco is the only place in the nation in which people did direct action anywhere militant enough to get on anyone's radar.

OK, so I had just moved here from South Bend, Indiana.  After having tried and disliked a couple of other pizza places, I decided to try Bus Stop.  I had it delivered (not knowing the place was so close to my flat), and the pizza was delicious.  Hot, with fresh ingredients, and really tasty.

I didn't order pizza from here for a while because I usually order when everyone but Mr. Pizzaman is closed.  The next time I did check out Bus Stop, and the following time, and the time after that, and the time after that, it was, well, OK.  I kept telling myself that it couldn't be true; hadn't my first pizza been excellent?  It had been, but it was just that time.

If you're looking for pizza-by-the-slice, this might be a good place for you.  They give you big slices that way.  But for the whole pie, there are definitely better options.
author: John S.

description:
If the 24 is 3 minutes away and you don't have time to wait for KK's to fry up a burger or King Foot to throw together a sub and if you have a cold that day so your taste buds are shot anyway and you're on your way to some kind of lengthy time commitment so you can't just pick something up somewhere else later then and only then would I recommend going into Bus Stop to get a slice of pizza.

Otherwise just skip it.
author: K K.

description:
I was on the south end of Divisadero the other night when I realized that I'd not eaten dinner yet. Seeing how I'd been drinking some, I thought it might be a good idea.

Slices were big (& priced accordingly), but quite good. Not half as bad as I remember them being the last time I was here, which was probably sometime in late '04. Sometimes memory can be deceiving. My personal unofficial boycott is hereby over.
author: Pete J.

description:
I'm going to join the herd and give this three stars. I am from New York (where pizza is great) and lived in Seattle (where pizza is, at best, variable- Pagliacci's is good, but NY pizza and gourmet kalamata-goat cheese-pesto slices are two different animals entirely) for a long time, so I will accept a wide variety of different pizza types. That said, the biggest advantage to Bus Stop is its location: across the street from my house. Their veggie slice is $3.50 and is loaded up with non-sauteed, non-canned mushrooms, black olives, peppers and onions. It is perfectly fine and functions as a meal substitute for me once a week, but it is NOTHING, NOTHING like New York pizza. It tastes more like Chicago pizza to me, because the crust is kind of buttery.

Otherwise, the store has various shady-looking salads and canned and bottled sodas. What I do like about the place is that I invariably end up getting into conversations with Divisidero denizens while waiting the ridiculously long-seeming 10min it takes to heat up a single slice. I have discussed the popularity of the World Cup, the fog, the election in Mexico and What To Do About the Homeless while waiting here. Your other option is sitting and reading the Guardian. Overall, if you live across the street, or are drunk, this place will suit your needs. Otherwise, elsewhere is probably a better bet.
author: alice t.

description:
Eating here before getting drunk is a serious mistake.

One star for the rather brilliant decision to stick this next to The Page.
author: Dave R.

description:
4.5 stars
Talking about pizza is akin to discussing religion or politics. No amount of arguing will sway people to understand where you are coming from if they're opposed to your point of view. That being said, I like Bus Stop and I like it a lot. I might not eat it as often as I do if they didn't deliver, but I have to give props to their tasty sauce and big slices. Every once in a while I have to get the special and indulge in the everything on it type of pizza, but Bus Stop excels at simple combos, like ham and onion, that's some good stuff.
author: Candice L.

description: I understand why the reviews are so mixed for this place.  Stopped by for a slice on Saturday night and could say it was one of the best slice of cheese pizza I've had, it could give Arinell's a run for it's money.  Came for a slice this evening and man does it suck.  I'd give it two stars at best.  The cheese wasn't melted, it was flavorless and the crust was hard.  They need better quality control.
author: Khac L.

description:
I give 3 stars b/c it was goood, the staple pepperoni pizza was filling & delicious. But - nothing that stands out.  Stay away from the veggie slice unless you like mushrooms - it was 60% sliced mushrooms. raw. 

But i'd go back for an easy filling lovely midnight ny snack.
author: Walrus C.

description: Pizza, Good! Service, Good! Take out bag? weird, by the time I got home cheese was a bit off the pizza. But it was pretty good and the cheesecake was BOMB. Will probably be back....
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is great because it's right in front of the bus stop. It's great to stop in and grab a piece of pizza. The plain single slice is only $2!!! I enjoyed the pizza and not having to wait for the bus in the cold.
author: Gladys C.

description:
Ordered a plain pie from here once with a friend and was pretty disappointed. It actually reminded me a little bit of cafeteria pizza (yikes!). Crust was a tough doughy and sauce didn't have much flavor. I ate a few slices because I was starving but didn't enjoy it much. My friend seemed to like it well enough, though, so maybe it just didn't do it for me.

Sigh... still waiting to find my staple pizza place in Lower Haight.
author: jim o.

description:
I really should hate this place. I grew up in NY, and thus know what a quality slice of pizza consists of. Bus Stop Pizza, as you can probably infer by the name, isn't the highest quality pizza joint in town. These are (technically) NY slices since they're built to the right proportions (I can't tell you how many times I've been dissapointed to open an SF pizza box to find a slice that's smaller than my face). And these are the staple ingredients of pizza, but the taste is off. Separately, the (pass the) tarty sauce, flour-caked crust, and milky cheese are pretty narsty, but it all comes together in a way that makes me come back to Bus Stop anytime I want a quick slice. Without toppings, mind you, since this place can't put anything on a pizza properly. 

Wait, why am I giving this place a 3-star review again?
author: David R.

description:
This was a better than average takeaway pizza.  We chose them because they were a little cheaper than some of the other nearby takeaway pizza places.    It was Saturday night at about 8pm (which I  assume is prime pizza takeout hour),  and ours came in 30 minutes.  The large was enough for two with a couple slices left over.  I guess if you're some sort of fatty you might find that it's not enough, but normal people will be fine.  Finally, the delivery guy was very friendly compared to the usual pizza-delivery-troll and he even helped me pick up a bunch of coins I dropped.  

Trivia: These are the guys who supply the free pizza in The Page for their Monday happy hour.
author: George S.

description: In a pinch, a slice here'll fill ya. But don't expect much more.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Great little pizza counter if your in the mood for a slice. Their meat pizza, called "Combo" is wicked, and the veggie one is good as well. They don't have slices just hanging around drying out all day - they make you the slice as you order it, so its fresher and hot.

Cheap as well. All in all, good spot.
author: Lee M.

description: Buy the slice,it don't matter what you want on this good pizza.i like sausage ,onion and mushrooms.Great place to stop and get a slice or two.Bus Stop Pizza is a winner
author: John C.

description:
This was the place I went to for a slice when I first signed the lease to my current apartment, so it has some tender memories for me.  I always order by the slice from this two table, 6 stool pizza stand.  The prices are great.  Don't expect an instant slice when you walk in.  They have slices that are partially made, then they had whatever you order, throw some cheese on top then throw it in the oven so your slice is fresh and yummy!  The slices are large, the cheese stringy and crust has that perfect blend of crisp-ness.

I gave it three stars instead of 4 because I never order a pie from them.  Only slices.  Perhaps that is just a weird thing with me where I think..this is a by-the-slice place...what?!  They do other stuff too like salad, buffalo wings and garlic bread?!  Bah!  Just give me a slice before I head out for the night!
author: Julie C.

description:
Bus Stop Pizza 1? Why, are there others?

Pretty damn close to pizza like they make in good old New York. Good prices too, and they deliver. I love their pizza.
author: Clar L.

description:
When I first moved to this neighborhood, singleness drove me to be a lazy evening diner. What's the laziest food I could possibly devour, I thought. Sure, pizza. Why not.

I tell you what. I've been going here for 3 years, and it has been consistently pretty OK. You guys know it's all about the sauce, right? Well, I like this sauce better than Arinell's. Sweeter and more tart. My favorite indulgence here is a double slice of reheated cheese with pesto on top. Mm-mm-mm. My cholesterol quivers with delight.

You can do way, way worse than to pick up a quick slice over here.
author: Rey T.

description: This place ain't bad. Hot cheesy Pizza, fast and cheap. What more do you judge it on? Sure there are other places with better sauce. The point is pizza preference is really in the mouth of the beholder.
author: Jorge N.

description: This is the place to go if you love cheese on your pizza. Very yummy. My friends and I had orderd a hawaiian pizza. It didn't take long before our nice hot, fresh out of the oven pizza came. It was so good!! The crust was nice and crispy. It's a pretty small place but not alot of people stick around to eat it. I would so sit there and eat it because that is the best way to enjoy pizza, fresh!
author: Annie W.

description:
I have been going to this place for over 15 years. At one point a high school friend actually owned this place. While it has gone through numerous owners over the years, their pizza is amazingly consistent.

I look at Bus Stop this way, it is a place which if I was thinking going out for sit down pizza, I would still consider having BusStop pizza even though it is a hole in the wall slices only place.

I have had Arinells over in Berkley and prefer Bus Stop. I think it is the mild, not too overpowering sauce, and the cheese which has that just oh-so right amount of almost coagilated oil on top of slightly browned cheese.

Ok, now I am pissed, I want a slice now!
author: Garfield J.

description:
there is NO PARKING here...lol.  what do you expect on Haight and Divisidero?

this is my backup pizza place.  it has LOTS of cheese on the pizza and they put the TOPPINGS underneath the cheese.

old school pizza people say when you put the toppings underneath the cheese the drippings go right into the pie shell and give it its flavor.  this has the flavors i love and its inexpensive for a pizza.  even during this time where everyone is either raising prices or lowering prices to stay alive.

this place has changed their hours a bit so don't expect them to be open until noon or later now.

its a good place BUT its cheesy.  So you could ask for HALF the cheese and still have enough.
author: Bing D.

description: When I was working at a silicon valley firm that will remain nameless (hint: it's a fruit).  The bus dropped me off right in front of Bus Stop Pizza.  so it was inevitable...I go in.  This in fact started off my quest.  Huge slices!  Medium thickness, solid sauce.  What's not to like?
author: Jeff J.

description: We ordered about 10 XLarge pies from here for my work,  I really didn't care for it.  The quality of the ingredients wasn't that great.  Some people at work said it was just  "Ok".  Judge for yourself.
author: Rpm R.

description: Pretty mediocre pizza, the people that work there are nice though. Never the place you WANT to go, always the place you go out of convenience. I always get the sausage, seems to be better than everything else I've tried there.
author: Daniel C.

description: Perfect post-alcohol slice of pizza.  Crispy but chewy, medium thick crust and cheesy goodness.  Also, the owner-purveyor, Sam, was super nice and did not seem to mind my companion's loud drunken ramblings and inquiries.
author: Jenny R.

description: Stick with the cheese pizza at this place.  The ingredients as toppings really make a slice disgusting.  Just leave it with the cheese and it is OK.  This is one of those places that only makes cheese slices and then adds toppings and heats them up on top of the slice.  We the toppings are not good quality and should be avoided.  They have pretty decent salad options here as well which is usually fairly good.  The family that runs the place is also friendly.  Like the new cable TV too because the old fuzzy picture thing was kind of annoying.
author: Anna G.

description: I live right around the corner and many a night I'll stumble off the 24 and into Bus Stop. Their pizza is not especially memorable, but it's not bad either. I like the cheese slice and otherwise will often order a slice with sausage, onion and green pepper. The toppings are generous and fresh. I like supporting this business because the owner is a great guy, working hard to support his family who also work in the shop quite often. I also like the cake slices they sell, be it black forest, carrot, chocolate or whatever else they happen to have in stock.
author: Warren F.

description:
I love this Pizza... I am truly addicted.  I always get plain cheese and add fresh basil at home.  

Delicious crust, love love love.
author: Bernadette G.

description: You know, I agree with GG's assessment of this place: its pretty good for a late night snack, but there is something missing that you can't put your finger on that keeps it from earning 4 stars.  I have a feeling it might be that it lacks flavor to some degree.  Escape and That's Amore seem to have more flavor/kick.  But the manager sure will give you a lesson on how to rewarm a slice.
author: Rick H.

description: The crust is neither too thin nor overbaked, the sauce has the right balance of sweet and acidic, and there's ample cheese on the pie. So why does the whole always seem less than the sum of its parts? With Mythic Pizza equidistant from my home, I'm more inclined to order from there on a regular basis, but if I'm walking past Bus Stop and in the mood for a slice, it will satisfy the yen.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Went to another pizza place on Divis, only to find it was closed for lunch. So, I dramatically tapped the Yelp app on my phone and found this place. I got two slices - a pepperoni and a jalapeno. They were blehhh. Nothing special. But as the saying goes, "average pizza is better than no pizza at all." I'd go back if I was walking down Divis and wanted pizza.
author: Aaron Z.

description: Wow.  For cheap, neighborhood slices, this is pretty good.  I had the pepperoni, it's greasy but when you have the craving and need to keep it on the cheap, accept no substitutes.
author: Curtis J.

description: I live a block away and the pizza is okay if your in a hurry. I would not go out of your way to come here b/c there is nothing special about the pizza; certainly no better or worse then the next one down the street. Its a clean spot, been here forever. I have never orderd a whole pie, just a slice or two. Inexpensive. You could do a lot worse.
author: Mike K.

description:
i got a slice of pizza waiting for the bus. it was one of those sna francisco afternoons where the temp drops 20 degrees and you're wearing a t-shirt. it's not that bad, but eating a nice hot slice of cheese pizza with garlic salt, red pepper, and parmesan sure beats being a little chilly. 

the best $2 i've ever spent! 

i can't wait to go back and spend more, the pizza is actually really good, starting with the soft crust and good tomato sauce.  
friendly staff too, and a warm dining room!!!!
author: oskar p.

description: It's a wonderful thing when your pizza comes out fresh from the oven, cheese dripping all over the place, pepperoni just lookin at you like, "eat me!". You'll enjoy Bus Stop pizza, especially because as of this writting a plain slice cost just $2.50. The one thong they need to wok on is their crust, which isn't crispy enough and is too doughy. Conveniently located near all the bars in NOPA.
author: Andrew K.

description: Eh...It will satisfy a hunger craving, but not much to write home about, I'd give it one more star if it weren't for the guy working the counter drooling over one of my gal pals.  It was like..."would you like some eyeball with your slice?
author: B H.

description: Not being from new york or chicago what do I know about pizza? Nothing I suppose except what I like and don't like. I like bus stop. Good sized slices, very inexpensive and you dont have to be drunk to enjoy them.
author: Jerry M.

description: Meh. Pretty janky slices... and that's saying a lot, considering I've only eaten them after heavy drinking, when I am least picky about my pizza. The slices are doughy and the later it gets, the more *old* the slices taste. The toppings just kind of sit on top... I mean, it's okay... and it's a cute, family-owned spot (which is dope), but if you're in the area and are feindin' for some pie that's close, tasty, and served late-night I feel like Mythic Pizza is a way mo' better choice.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I have been patronizing this joint for years. Decent pizza at great prices. This is also a true "Mom and Pop" place. They have been around a long time and deserve your support. 3 Stars for the Pizza and One Star for them being very pleasant people.
author: Mitchel B.

description: Maybe I'm strange, but this pizza happens to be the kind I like, it's very good! I like to take home a slice then toast it in the oven for a couple minutes....... awesomeness. I live upstairs and the owner is very friendly and all the kids I watch adore the pizza, they gobble it up over all others.
author: nicole m.

description: It's a good bet that the pizza here won't make you vomit. There is, however, very little reason to grab a slice here if you haven't just come stumbling out of The Page.
author: Andrew S.

description: If you are coming from bars on Lower Haight, or bars on Divisadero or really need a quick slice, Bus Stop will do.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Don't know how long that pizza has been sitting there. You order, they take some old slice of pizza, throw some toppings on, and heat it up. Call me a snob, but I like fresh pizza. Edible though, so two-star rating.
author: Mark A.

description: Exactly that: A-OK. This is not the best pizza but it is by far NOT the worst. It's the typical neighborhood pizza parlor that's mostly meant for take-out, delivery or slices. There is hardly any seating inside and the place is poorly lit and dirty. But if you order a couple large pizzas for delivery, they are fast, the prices are fair and the pizza is decent. They have a wide selection of toppings but it's the standard stuff. You can't get truffles or "pan-seared pea snaps" here. So if you have a pizza craving that needs to be satisfied ASAP, go here.
author: L. L.

description: Great pizza. I am not a pizza snob, though I like the sensibility of places like Pauline's. But Pauline's doesn't deliver. Bus Stop is good stuff. Grab a slice of cheese with a soda and wait for the 24. Oh yeah, and suck it.
author: Peter B.

description: When I first moved to the city I lived across the street from this lovely establishment. Many a drunken stupor was eased by these heavenly slices o' cheeseness. This is one of my favorite pizza stops in the city. The owner and his family are really funny and nice if you get to know them although it may take some time to do that. I recommend trying a slice of spinach, ham and feta. Daaaamnnn.
author: Kyle J.

description: CHEAP! The staff is not friendly, and if you ask for a bigger to go box on a cold night be prepared to be ridiculed. Some days are better than others, that's why they get two stars.
author: Devi G.

description:
My husband and I are extremely picky about pizza, and we are obsessed with the pizza here!  

We always set our oven to 500 and then order cheese slices that are "very well-done" for pickup.  Once we get home, we put the slices in the oven until they are sizzling.  I add some salt and garlic powder while my husband adds garlic powder and red chili flakes.  It is the best take-home meal ever!!!  The crust, sauce and cheese are perfection.

We found out recently, however, that getting a large cheese pizza is no good!  Somehow the slices from the large tasted not nearly as good as those from the individual slices.  I think the proportions were wrong - suddenly the crust was too thick.
author: A K.

description:
great place to get pizza after every other restaurant on the street has closed. not because it's a 'last ditch' option for food, mind you. i was more making a point that restaurants on divis close unnaturally early.

anyway, they'll make pretty much any slice you can request (within their ingredients limits, of course) and they're all damn tasty. i suggest the pepperoni. i'm a simple dude.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Bus stop is an appropriate name.  If your hungry, and your at the bus stop in front, go here.  If not, skip it.  The crust is doughy, but still crisp.  Sauce is tasty if a bit sweet, and the cheese has that scary flat look.  It still satisfies, but it's not worth a trip out of your way.
author: Herbert S.

description: I've only eaten pizza from 2 different places in SF and Bus Stop was one and the other was North Beach Pizza.  I prefer Bus Stop.  The slices were huge and not overly greasy.  I can eat 2 slices of Bus Stop and I'm done.  My fav being the Hawaiian.  Also a late night spot good for after a night of drinking and needing some yummy pizza to calm the drunken hunger.  Plus, it's right in front of the bus stop, hence the name.
author: David C.

description: It's difficult to be unbiased when you've spent as much time as I have eating this pizza, I think it's good and agree that it's all about the sauce. When I lived nearby it was a habit, we lived next door to the family that owns it and would watch the grandparents chase after the rugrats as the folks tossed some pie. I've spent many late nights on the way home staring at the old photographs and wondering about the past as I awaited my hot slice made just the way I like it. They also have pretty good salads.
author: Colleen B.

description: Double-parked in front, husband ran in, came back to the car in roughly 7 min. with a couple of slices of pepperoni pizzas. The first bite, while driving down Divisadero, was amazing! In one bite I tasted all what makes a perfect pizza; spicy pepperoni, tangy tomato sauce blended with oregano, and a thin-crust of heavenly dough. Wow!
author: Zee R.

description: I eat here way way more than I should.  It's easy, convenient and ok.  I can't really say I like the pizza, but I don't necessarily dislike it either.  I don't think I would order a pie or make a point to go, but it really is perfect for grabbing a slice near Haight and Divis.  Sometimes they close a little earlier than I would like when I'm headed home from The Page.
author: Zach J.

description: My slice of pizza from Bus Stop was not bad. I totally expected it to disappoint but it did not. In fact, I'm almost wiling to say--nay--I AM willing to say, I enjoyed this particular pizza experience!
author: N S.

description: When I first moved to SF over 10 years ago, i lived right across the street from Bus Stop Pizza. Their Bus Stop special is excellent. Sauce is their key. Crust could be improved. I still order Bus Stop every 2-3 months even though I live in Bernal.
author: Scott M.

description: Price is good, the service is easy, and the time between you and your pizza .....less than 6 minutes. Worth it.
author: Joe J.

description:
Someone wrote: "Damn, this is a good slice of NY right here--"

No, it's pretty gross pizza. I've been here more times than I can count, but Pizza Volare down Haight is better. Not great, but at least it's good. Next comes Mythic Pizza, then this place. It's not terrible, but the cheese they use is waxy and not unlike the kind on frozen pizza. This is nowhere near NY, though. Bleh.

Sure is cheap, though, and it's quick and right by my place.
author: Anthony O.

description: Just another to add to the list of good pizza not great.  When oh when SF will you bring me a great crakcer style pizza???
author: brian m.

description: Good stuff. Sauce was spot-on. Cheese was good, crust a little too bready. But then, I'm a harsh Pizza critic. Plain slice always, folded down the middle. Bus Stop Pizza has definitely earned a spot in my top-5 Bay Area pizza joints.
author: Yotam L.

description: Delicious crust, fresh toppings, fast delivery...What more could you want?
author: Mitra F.

description: The prices are fair, service is quick, and the gentleman who runs the joint is a real swell guy. This place should be a staple for those who work/live in the Haight to Geary stretch of Divisadero. I wouldn't claim it to be the best food in the area but it is probably the best value.
author: j g.

description: Having sampled the DYL tour first hand, I needed a quick bite before I headed home.  I had eyed a slice that Fong had brought to the 'tour' and kept that in mind.  I headed down the block and found they were still open and serving up slices.  I didn't quite get the perfect slice that Fong touted, but it was a very good slice.  It was just a reheated cheese with added toppings.  I guess after a nite of drinking, anything reheated in the oven is going to taste alright. As  I waited for my slice to be ready, the owner discussed relationships with us and what was wrong with women today, who expect men to do everything for them.  Very enlightening moment.  My slice arrived warm, but not piping hot with melting cheese...and that was ok.  I didn't want to have to wait to eat it.  In all fairness, the pizza's crust was pretty good.  It was almost like a cracker crust...crispy, yet still a little thick and chewy.  The sauce was not overpowering either.  I scarfed it down and considered ordering another slice, but decided that there would be a chance for that the next time.
author: JeFF T.

description: every once in a while, i'll have a hawaiian pizza slice craving, this is where i go to feed it.
author: Pickle R.

description: a solid three stars. good for what it is. slice of black olive pizza had olives and hot cheese. every thing you need when you've had a lot to drink and need to soak up some of the booze.
author: scott c.

description: the guys working here are nice, but the pizza itself was pretty mediocre.  it's cheap, it's conveniently located, it's fast, but i can't say that i'll hurry back.  i'd rather walk the few extra blocks to stelladoro, on divisidero between fulton and mcallister, though their pizza really isn't all that much better.
author: christopher b.
